questions.question: Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: 'I would have called you if I ___ your number.'
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'Had' is used in the third conditional to refer to past unreal situations.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. In the third conditional, 'if' is followed by 'had' + past participle.
questions.explanation: The third conditional is formed with 'if' + past perfect in the 'if' clause and 'would have' + past participle in the main clause.

questions.question: Choose the correct word to complete the sentence: 'The film was so interesting that I ___ to watch it again.'
questions.messageForCorrectAnswer: Correct! 'Wanted' is appropriate because the past tense matches the context of the sentence.
questions.messageForIncorrectAnswer: Incorrect. The past simple tense 'wanted' is needed to match the past context.
questions.explanation: When describing past situations, the past simple tense is used to indicate completed actions.
